import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
#import chart_studio.plotly as py
import seaborn as sns
import plotly as py
import plotly.express as px
%matplotlib inline
import plotly.graph_objects as go
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots

# Make Plotly work in your Jupyter Notebook
from plotly.offline import download_plotlyjs, init_notebook_mode, plot, iplot 
init_notebook_mode(connected = True)

import cufflinks as cf

# Use Plotly locally
cf.go_offline()

source.155a96d9:
df_dp["WINTER"] = df_dp["DEC"] + df_dp["JAN"]
df_dp["SPRING"] = df_dp["FEB"] + df_dp["MAR"]
df_dp["SUMMER"] = df_dp["APR"] + df_dp["MAY"] + df_dp["JUN"]
df_dp["MONSOON"] = df_dp["JUL"] + df_dp["AUG"] + df_dp["SEP"]
df_dp["AUTUMN"] = df_dp["OCT"] + df_dp["NOV"]
source.bc6cd575:
df_dp_melt = pd.melt(df_dp, id_vars = ["SUBDIVISION", "YEAR"], value_vars = ["WINTER", "SPRING",
                                                                    "SUMMER", "MONSOON", "AUTUMN"])
df_dp_melt1 = df_dp_melt.groupby(["SUBDIVISION", "variable"])["value"].sum().reset_index()

source.43dce72c: The minimum rainfall is noted in Saurashtra and Kutch region while Chattisgargh have comparitively more value. Also the rainfall is noted only in the months of July, August and September while in other months there is no minimum rainfall at all. Also in 2002 the month of July has minimum rainfall in every state.
source.ecafb458: Arunachal Pradesh shows the maximum rainfall. However the data for Arunachal Pradesh starts from 1916. Till 1968 there is slow and steady decline in rainfall and after 1968 there are no peaks with steady rain fall.
source.052ca0fb: Please do comment about your suggestions and if you like the notebook give an upvote!
source.fcd46d3a: ## See the location of subdivision in India
source.8bc19690: The above graph clearly shows the rainfall trend in Arunachal Pradesh. We can see that June-September are major month, the average rainfall in this month is more 1965 and less thereafter.
source.2d2feb48: Lakshadweep has less rainfall compared to Andaman & Nicobar Islands. Also months of November and December shows rainfall in Andaman & Nicobar Islands.
source.94566e7b: ## Check the unique subdivisions and Year
source.73a692c3: In above plot we can see that most of the states have rainfall less than average. Coastal Karnataka have most rainfall whereas West Rajasthan has least rainfall.
source.dfdc2335:
EDA Of Rainfall In India

Photo by Roman Synkevych on Unsplash
source.86a801cf: From above we can see that spring has the least rainfall in all states while monsoon has maximum rainfall. Among all the states above Vidarbha has the maximum rainfall in Deccan Plateau.
source.bf525271: The rainfall in July is maximum as it is a monsoon month. Whereas the winter season shows least rainfall.
source.f1c1a1ba: The location of subdivisions are clearly visible and now it will be easy for us to allocate the subdivisions according to the physiographical features of India.
source.a98c23d3: Coastal Karnataka receives maximum rain with increasing trend upto 1961. There is sharp dip in 1941. In years after 2000 2013 shows the peak which is considerably less compared to previous years.
source.e397c974: The months of June-September shows maximum rainfall where as Jan-Feb show least. Also Orrisa shows maximum rainfall in those months.
source.288d9ed7: The above graph shows the maximum rainfall over all years in the given state. Before 1980's we can see that the month of July, September, August have recorded maximum rainfall at multiple instances however with the onset of 2000's there is dip in maximum rainfall.
source.e295b431: Western Coast line of India is getting more rain but Andaman and Nicobar Islands receive more rain compared to Lakshadweep.
source.2016a9ca: In this we have not done the subdivision analysis but instead we have taken the whole plain together and calculated the average of 3 years in different months. As usual the month of June-September shows the maximum rainfall and we can see the patter here as well. After the period of 9 year there is 3 year period which have less rainfall. However this is not the case after 2010 and there is less rainfall than expected.
source.4d2803a3:
The above subplots shoes clearly that June-September are the major months of rainfall. Also East Rajathan has more rainfall than West Rajasthan. It is because the major paortion of desert lies in West Rajasthan.
Surprisingly after 2000 there is upward trend in the rainfall received in month of June-September.
